content:
Yeah, I've definitely noticed some changes in my fitness level since I started commuting to work on the Synapse. I've been able to increase my ride frequency and distance, and I've noticed improvements in my cardiovascular endurance and overall stamina. It's been great to feel myself getting stronger and more confident on the bike.

As for new routes, I've actually been trying to mix it up a bit and explore some new areas around town. There's a great bike trail near my house that I've been meaning to check out, and I'm planning to do a longer ride out to the countryside soon. The Synapse has given me the confidence to take on more challenging rides and explore new territories.

Speaking of which, I've been thinking about getting a bike computer or GPS device to help me track my routes and rides. Do you have any recommendations or experience with these types of devices?
